A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Six family members have now seen this movie\, and all six of us feel the same way. Character development?  Didn't happen.  Intriguing plot?   Having the good guys running away from the bad guys (and being low on fuel) just didn't cut it.  Thematically?  This was the most annoying aspect of all.  Star Wars is about good\, evil\, destiny\, sacrifice and heroism.  It turned Luke Skywalker into a self centered\, cranky old guy.  Poe got called silly names like "Flyboy\," and Finn had the same arc as in the prior movie. 

 All six of us hated this movie.  There won't be any repeat theater visits as in movies past\, nor will anyone be buying Star Wars toys and t-shirts.  

Worst scene -- Carrie Fischer flying through space like Tinkerbell.  

Best scene:  The cute little critters that looked like penguins. 

Next Best Scene: The closing credit. 

P.S.  Maybe it's just me\, but the music was obtrusive--maybe to cover up the lack of meaningful dialogue. 

Oh well.
